intro: Cunila arechevaletae, commonly known as the Arechevaletae wormwood, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and distinctive foliage. It is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central America, particularly in Mexico. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. Its chemical composition includes various essential oils and sesquiterpene lactones, which contribute to its medicinal properties. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
